New super mario bros was repetitive and annoying. The levels don't get harder. It doesn't even feel like mario. The enemies dance to the goddamn music. It's a sorry excuse for a mario game. And seriously? You're complaining about the one challenging aspect of Galaxy? Miyamoto put that in there to cater to the more classic players who were used to a challenge. Don't you remember running around every level of mario 64 to collect all the coins to get the final star of each level? Maybe you were the kind of person to just ignore that. The games are deeper than the characters and the aesthetic value of not having "crap on the back". It's about the experience and the challenge the player overcomes.

Personally, I found Super Mario Sunshine to be wonderful. Even if you did have an oversized backpack/water gun hybrid strapped to your back, it didn't hinder the ability to move/jump as quick as ever.

Though I will say that after depending on F.L.U.D.D. for most of the game, the little platforming missions without it always frustrated me.

(...and how can anyone hate on Luigi's Mansion?)

"hey, they tried new game mechanics. It's a horrible thing". Generally, when people talk about video game series they like in a negative way, they are talking on one of two subject lines. A) They tried something new, and I didn't like it. Or B) There hasn't been enough innovation. 

None of the things mentioned in this video are "mistakes". They are different attempts to make a old game franchise interesting. New game mechanics are essential. Even if they aren't as enjoyable for you.
